string.value: #p1052103# in #m103000000# starts talking to you. Could she have caught the thief?

#p1052103# says that her underling found a clue about the thief in #m105040300#, where the incident occurred. Unfortunately, the clue was lost on it's way to #m103000000# because a #o3110100# attacked. She asks that you recover the #bClue#k about the thief from the #r#o3110100#s#k... 

#i4032463# #t4032463# #b#c4032463# / 1#k
#p1052103# started to read the document with a serious look on her face. You can feel her desire to restore #m103000000#'s honor.
You've waited so long, Evan. I've finally found the clue about the culprit who stole the #t4032464#! Finally, #m103000000# will clear its name! Or soon...because there seems to be one more problem.

I had one of my underlings hide out #b#m105040300##k to find the clue. He's the go-to person for a stakeout but he's so weak... As he was returning to #m103000000# he was attacked by a #o3110100# and lost the document containing all the clues.
If you're not too busy, will you find that document for me? Just eliminate some #o3110100# in the swamp area to find it. Defeating a few #o3110100#s should be a breeze for you. What do you say?
Go to the swamp and eliminate some #r#o3110100##ks and find the #b#t4032463##k. That document will clear #m103000000# of this false charge!
Hm... #p1040001# and even #p1040000# have raved about how strong you are. Were they wrong?

Oh, you've brought the #t4032463#! You probably won't be able to read it since it's in a code that only Thieves can read. Here, let me see it. I'll be able to find out who is responsible for all of this!
Haven't you found the #b#t4032463##k yet? I'm telling you, the #r#o3110100##ks in the swamp have it. Go on and find it, fast! Help #m103000000# recover its honorable name!
